com.redhat.rhn.common.security

Class SessionSwap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.common.security.SessionSwap

  • public class SessionSwap
extends java.lang.Object
    SessionSwap, a class to handle secure data manipulations in a way consistent with SessionSwap from the perl codebase. Effectively a wrapper to make it a bit easier to exchange data with different parts of our codebase that speak different languages. A session swap token is basically a tuple of a certain form that contains N pieces of hex data and a signature that is based on a shared secret. Someday this should become a true HMAC, but for now, it is an older algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • encodeData

        public static java.lang.String encodeData(java.lang.String[] in)
        given an array of strings, compute the hex session swap, which contains both the original data and the 'signature'. so the resulting string is encapsulated and can be passed around as 'signed' data.
        Parameters:
        in - an array of strings, all of which must be valud hex
        Returns:
        String of the signature, in the form "D1:D2:D3xHEX" where D1... are the input data and HEX is the hex signature.

      • encodeData

        public static java.lang.String encodeData(java.lang.String in)
        simple wrapper around encodeData(String[]) for easier consumption
        Parameters:
        in - The data to encode
        Returns:
        The reulting session swap string.
        See Also:
        encodeData

      • extractData

        public static java.lang.String[] extractData(java.lang.String in)
        given a session swap string, this will crack it open and return the data.
        Parameters:
        in - The session swap to inspect.
        Returns:
        The data extracted from the session swap
        Throws:
        SessionSwapTamperException - if the data was tampered with, making it easy to use and trust

      • generateSwapKey

        public static java.lang.String generateSwapKey(java.lang.String data)
        compute the md5sum of key1:key2:(data):key3:key4.
        Parameters:
        data - to compute
        Returns:
        computed data

      • computeMD5Hash

        public static java.lang.String computeMD5Hash(java.lang.String text)
        compute md5sum for any arbitrary text

        Returns:

      • rhnHmacData

        public static java.lang.String rhnHmacData(java.util.List<java.lang.String> text)
        Takes an array of strings and SHA1 hashes the 'joined' results. This is a port of the RHN::SessionSwap:rhn_hmac_data method.
        Parameters:
        text - array to SHA1 hash
        Returns:
        String of hex chars
